name: (1R)-3-Oxoindane-1-carboxylic acid
Reason: 1-oxoindane has a melting point of around 100 degrees Celsius. The basic unit for comparison is the indane ring, which has a melting point of -10.0 degrees Celsius. The introduction of the carboxylic acid group increases the melting point due to the presence of a carboxyl group, which can participate in hydrogen bonding and form a more rigid structure. The methoxy group also increases the melting point due to the increased molecular weight and van der Waals forces. The oxo group introduces additional rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, further raising the melting point. The carbonyl group also increases the melting point due to the presence of a carbonyl group, which can participate in hydrogen bonding and form a more rigid structure. The effects are additive.
